description: Returns information about all Amazon Lightsail virtual private servers, or instances.

parameters.name: pageToken
parameters.description: The token to advance to the next page of results from your request. To get a page token, perform an initial GetInstances request. If your results are paginated, the response will return a next page token that you can specify as the page token in a subsequent request.

nested_items.name: instances
nested_items.description: An array of key-value pairs containing information about your instances.

nested_items.name: name
nested_items.description: The name the user gave the instance ( Amazon_Linux_2023-1).

nested_items.name: arn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the instance ( arn:aws:lightsail:us-east-2:123456789101:Instance/244ad76f-8aad-4741-809f-12345EXAMPLE).

nested_items.name: supportCode
nested_items.description: The support code. Include this code in your email to support when you have questions about an instance or another resource in Lightsail. This code enables our support team to look up your Lightsail information more easily.

nested_items.name: createdAt
nested_items.description: The timestamp when the instance was created ( 1479734909.17) in Unix time format.

nested_items.name: availabilityZone
nested_items.description: The Availability Zone. Follows the format us-east-2a (case-sensitive).

nested_items.name: regionName
nested_items.description: The Amazon Web Services Region name.

nested_items.name: resourceType
nested_items.description: The type of resource (usually Instance).

nested_items.name: tags
nested_items.description: The tag keys and optional values for the resource. For more information about tags in Lightsail, see the Amazon Lightsail Developer Guide.

nested_items.name: key
nested_items.description: The key of the tag.

nested_items.name: value
nested_items.description: The value of the tag.

nested_items.name: blueprintId
nested_items.description: The blueprint ID ( amazon_linux_2023).

nested_items.name: blueprintName
nested_items.description: The friendly name of the blueprint ( Amazon Linux 2023).

nested_items.name: bundleId
nested_items.description: The bundle for the instance ( micro_x_x).

nested_items.name: addOns
nested_items.description: An array of objects representing the add-ons enabled on the instance.

nested_items.name: name
nested_items.description: The name of the add-on.

nested_items.name: status
nested_items.description: The status of the add-on.

nested_items.name: snapshotTimeOfDay
nested_items.description: The daily time when an automatic snapshot is created.

nested_items.name: nextSnapshotTimeOfDay
nested_items.description: The next daily time an automatic snapshot will be created.

nested_items.name: threshold
nested_items.description: The trigger threshold of the action.

nested_items.name: duration
nested_items.description: The amount of idle time in minutes after which your virtual computer will automatically stop.

nested_items.name: isStaticIp
nested_items.description: A Boolean value indicating whether this instance has a static IP assigned to it.

nested_items.name: privateIpAddress
nested_items.description: The private IP address of the instance.

nested_items.name: publicIpAddress
nested_items.description: The public IP address of the instance.

nested_items.name: ipv6Addresses
nested_items.description: The IPv6 addresses of the instance.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: ipAddressType
nested_items.description: The IP address type of the instance.

nested_items.name: cpuCount
nested_items.description: The number of vCPUs the instance has.

nested_items.name: disks
nested_items.description: The disks attached to the instance.

nested_items.name: name
nested_items.description: The unique name of the disk.

nested_items.name: arn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the disk.

nested_items.name: supportCode
nested_items.description: The support code. Include this code in your email to support when you have questions about an instance or another resource in Lightsail. This code enables our support team to look up your Lightsail information more easily.

nested_items.name: createdAt
nested_items.description: The date when the disk was created.

nested_items.name: availabilityZone
nested_items.description: The Availability Zone. Follows the format us-east-2a (case-sensitive).

nested_items.name: regionName
nested_items.description: The Amazon Web Services Region name.

nested_items.name: resourceType
nested_items.description: The Lightsail resource type ( Disk).

nested_items.name: tags
nested_items.description: The tag keys and optional values for the resource. For more information about tags in Lightsail, see the Amazon Lightsail Developer Guide.

nested_items.name: key
nested_items.description: The key of the tag.

nested_items.name: value
nested_items.description: The value of the tag.

nested_items.name: addOns
nested_items.description: An array of objects representing the add-ons enabled on the disk.

nested_items.name: name
nested_items.description: The name of the add-on.

nested_items.name: status
nested_items.description: The status of the add-on.

nested_items.name: snapshotTimeOfDay
nested_items.description: The daily time when an automatic snapshot is created.

nested_items.name: nextSnapshotTimeOfDay
nested_items.description: The next daily time an automatic snapshot will be created.

nested_items.name: threshold
nested_items.description: The trigger threshold of the action.

nested_items.name: duration
nested_items.description: The amount of idle time in minutes after which your virtual computer will automatically stop.

nested_items.name: sizeInGb
nested_items.description: The size of the disk in GB.

nested_items.name: isSystemDisk
nested_items.description: A Boolean value indicating whether this disk is a system disk (has an operating system loaded on it).

nested_items.name: iops
nested_items.description: The input/output operations per second (IOPS) of the disk.

nested_items.name: path
nested_items.description: The disk path.

nested_items.name: state
nested_items.description: Describes the status of the disk.

nested_items.name: attachedTo
nested_items.description: The resources to which the disk is attached.

nested_items.name: isAttached
nested_items.description: A Boolean value indicating whether the disk is attached.

nested_items.name: attachmentState
nested_items.description: (Discontinued) The attachment state of the disk.

nested_items.name: gbInUse
nested_items.description: (Discontinued) The number of GB in use by the disk.

nested_items.name: autoMountStatus
nested_items.description: The status of automatically mounting a storage disk to a virtual computer.

nested_items.name: ramSizeInGb
nested_items.description: The amount of RAM in GB on the instance ( 1.0).

nested_items.name: networking
nested_items.description: Information about the public ports and monthly data transfer rates for the instance.

nested_items.name: monthlyTransfer
nested_items.description: The amount of data in GB allocated for monthly data transfers.

nested_items.name: gbPerMonthAllocated
nested_items.description: The amount allocated per month (in GB).

nested_items.name: ports
nested_items.description: An array of key-value pairs containing information about the ports on the instance.

nested_items.name: fromPort
nested_items.description: The first port in a range of open ports on an instance.
TCP and UDP - 0 to 65535

ICMP - The ICMP type for IPv4 addresses. For example, specify 8 as the fromPort (ICMP type), and -1 as the toPort (ICMP code), to enable ICMP Ping. For more information, see Control Messages on Wikipedia.
ICMPv6 - The ICMP type for IPv6 addresses. For example, specify 128 as the fromPort (ICMPv6 type), and 0 as toPort (ICMPv6 code). For more information, see Internet Control Message Protocol for IPv6.

nested_items.name: toPort
nested_items.description: The last port in a range of open ports on an instance.
TCP and UDP - 0 to 65535

ICMP - The ICMP code for IPv4 addresses. For example, specify 8 as the fromPort (ICMP type), and -1 as the toPort (ICMP code), to enable ICMP Ping. For more information, see Control Messages on Wikipedia.
ICMPv6 - The ICMP code for IPv6 addresses. For example, specify 128 as the fromPort (ICMPv6 type), and 0 as toPort (ICMPv6 code). For more information, see Internet Control Message Protocol for IPv6.

nested_items.name: protocol
nested_items.description: The IP protocol name.

tcp - Transmission Control Protocol (TCP) provides reliable, ordered, and error-checked delivery of streamed data between applications running on hosts communicating by an IP network. If you have an application that doesn't require reliable data stream service, use UDP instead.
all - All transport layer protocol types. For more general information, see Transport layer on Wikipedia.

udp - With User Datagram Protocol (UDP), computer applications can send messages (or datagrams) to other hosts on an Internet Protocol (IP) network. Prior communications are not required to set up transmission channels or data paths. Applications that don't require reliable data stream service can use UDP, which provides a connectionless datagram service that emphasizes reduced latency over reliability. If you do require reliable data stream service, use TCP instead.

icmp - Internet Control Message Protocol (ICMP) is used to send error messages and operational information indicating success or failure when communicating with an instance. For example, an error is indicated when an instance could not be reached. When you specify icmp as the protocol, you must specify the ICMP type using the fromPort parameter, and ICMP code using the toPort parameter.

icmp6 - Internet Control Message Protocol (ICMP) for IPv6. When you specify icmp6 as the protocol, you must specify the ICMP type using the fromPort parameter, and ICMP code using the toPort parameter.

nested_items.name: accessFrom
nested_items.description: The location from which access is allowed. For example, Anywhere (0.0.0.0/0), or Custom if a specific IP address or range of IP addresses is allowed.

nested_items.name: accessType
nested_items.description: The type of access ( Public or Private).

nested_items.name: commonName
nested_items.description: The common name of the port information.

nested_items.name: accessDirection
nested_items.description: The access direction ( inbound or outbound).

nested_items.name: cidrs
nested_items.description: The IPv4 address, or range of IPv4 addresses (in CIDR notation) that are allowed to connect to an instance through the ports, and the protocol.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: ipv6Cidrs
nested_items.description: The IPv6 address, or range of IPv6 addresses (in CIDR notation) that are allowed to connect to an instance through the ports, and the protocol. Only devices with an IPv6 address can connect to an instance through IPv6; otherwise, IPv4 should be used.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: cidrListAliases
nested_items.description: An alias that defines access for a preconfigured range of IP addresses.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: code
nested_items.description: The status code for the instance.

nested_items.name: name
nested_items.description: The state of the instance ( running or pending).

nested_items.name: username
nested_items.description: The user name for connecting to the instance ( ec2-user).

nested_items.name: sshKeyName
nested_items.description: The name of the SSH key being used to connect to the instance ( LightsailDefaultKeyPair).

nested_items.name: metadataOptions
nested_items.description: The metadata options for the Amazon Lightsail instance.

nested_items.name: state
nested_items.description: The state of the metadata option changes.
pending - The metadata options are being updated. The instance is not yet ready to process metadata traffic with the new selection.
applied - The metadata options have been successfully applied to the instance.

nested_items.name: httpTokens
nested_items.description: The state of token usage for your instance metadata requests.

nested_items.name: httpEndpoint
nested_items.description: Indicates whether the HTTP metadata endpoint on your instances is enabled or disabled.

nested_items.name: httpPutResponseHopLimit
nested_items.description: The desired HTTP PUT response hop limit for instance metadata requests. A larger number means that the instance metadata requests can travel farther.

nested_items.name: httpProtocolIpv6
nested_items.description: Indicates whether the IPv6 endpoint for the instance metadata service is enabled or disabled.

nested_items.name: nextPageToken
nested_items.description: The token to advance to the next page of results from your request.
